intro: Placus ternatensis, commonly known as the Ternate starling, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
